sn55.22:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans, near Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.
sn55.22:4.3: Then Mahānāma the Sakyan went up to the Buddha,
sn55.22:4.4: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn55.22:4.6: “Sir, this Kapilavatthu is successful and prosperous and full of people, with cramped cul-de-sacs.
sn55.22:4.7: In the late afternoon, after paying homage to the Buddha or an esteemed mendicant, I enter Kapilavatthu.
sn55.22:4.13: At that time I lose mindfulness regarding the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
sn55.22:4.15: ‘If I were to die at this time, where would I be reborn in my next life?’”
sn55.22:5.1: “Do not fear, Mahānāma! Do not fear, Mahānāma!
sn55.22:5.2: Your death will not be a bad one; your passing will not be a bad one.
sn55.22:5.3: A noble disciple who has four things slants, slopes, and inclines towards extinguishment.
sn55.22:5.5: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.22:5.10: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones …
sn55.22:6.1: Suppose there was a tree that slants, slopes, and inclines to the east. If it was cut off at the root where would it fall?”
sn55.22:6.2: “Sir, it would fall in the direction that it slants, slopes, and inclines.”
sn55.22:6.3: “In the same way, a noble disciple who has four things slants, slopes, and inclines towards extinguishment.”
